message.content:
cs.LG, cs.DS, cs.IT, cs.NA, cs.CC 

The paper deals with the problem of efficiently estimating a simplex from uniformly random points, which is a problem in machine learning and statistics. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.LG (Machine Learning). The paper also uses techniques from Independent Component Analysis (ICA), which is a subfield of signal processing and information theory, suggesting that cs.IT (Information Theory) and cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) are also likely sub-categories. The algorithm presented in the paper involves polynomially many arithmetic operations, indicating that cs.NA (Numerical Analysis) may also be a relevant sub-category. Finally, the paper involves analyzing the moments of the uniform measure on a simplex, which is a problem in computational geometry, suggesting that cs.CC (Computational Geometry) may also be a relevant sub-category.
